title: Installation
description: Get started by installing the documentation portal

content.text: Before you begin, make sure you have the following installed on your system:

items: npm, yarn, or pnpm package manager

content.text: The fastest way to get started is by cloning the repository and installing dependencies:

content.title: Clone and Install
content.code:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/your-username/docs-portal.git

# Navigate to the project directory
cd docs-portal

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start the development server
npm run dev

content.text: If you prefer to set up the project manually, follow these steps:

content.code: npm install @radix-ui/react-accordion @radix-ui/react-dialog @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu @radix-ui/react-scroll-area @radix-ui/react-sheet lucide-react next-themes class-variance-authority clsx tailwind-merge

content.text: After installation, you'll need to configure a few files:

content.title: tailwind.config.js

content.text: To verify that everything is working correctly:

items: Start the development server with `npm run dev`
Open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:3000`
You should see the documentation portal homepage
Try navigating through different sections using the sidebar
Test the dark mode toggle in the header

content.text: You've successfully installed the documentation portal. You can now start customizing it for your project by adding your own content and modifying the navigation structure.
